projects.title: Pronto
projects.description: Although shipping is a very old industry, today there is a huge potential in creating value for ships calling at ports. Processes that can be optimized -by improved information- are chartering and planning of vessels, deadweight utilization, optimum speed and port turnaround time . The intention is to come to an international approach of port call optimization through processing up to date information. Essential for all fleets for running a competitive business and so to improve on port efficiency. Mission; optimize port calls for all visiting commercial vessels by improving the quality and availability of nautical port information, both master and event data. To present and base these data on existing standards and formats and to develop internationally accepted standards. To develop applications and make the data available and usable within a number of processes. Decisions that are supported by nautical port information will lead to a reduction of costs and emissions and general improvement of safety for shipping, terminals and service providers.

projects.title: Port of Rotterdam - Focus on Vessels
projects.description:
On initiative of the Harbor Master Port of Rotterdam, and in cooperation with nautical chain partners, the project “Focus on Vessels” has been initiated. 

Due to the growth of the Harbor of Rotterdam there will be more intensive vessel traffic and also an increased competition between harbors.    
To secure that Rotterdam can stay the best and most efficient Harbor of Europe the cooperation of all involved organizations needs to be intensified.
Communication improvement is crucial for the reliability of the whole nautical chain, and will have a positive effect on vessel idle time.

One element of the project is to accomplish harmonized maritime time definitions necessary for an efficient planning 
Next to planning purposes for port management, precise time definitions are needed by contracting parties visiting the port/vessel.
At present there is no harmonized system of time definitions whereas this is the moment to agree on identical definitions for use in international and European e-navigation 
and e-maritime developments.     
Practical this will mean that the current used time slot definitions will be based on the input of international maritime organizations
(e.g. Bimco, Nautical Institute, EHMC), so more focused on the vessel than on the ports.

Another part is the technical side of communication, currently there are too many different systems which are also not that user-friendly.
This will be challenged in a sub-group “Port Connect”, combined with the new platform building project of Portbase.

This can only be achieved by cooperation of all involved partners, which captured in the “Focus on Vessels” project, planned to be completed at 2015.
The project is unique and not been applied in any other Port in the world.
   
This flyer is distributed by the Port of Rotterdam and cooperative nautical partners, the first edition can be supplied on request.

projects.title: Port of Rotterdam - Port Connect
projects.description:
Port Connect is a crucial part of the 'Focus on Vessels' project.
Improved and efficient communication within the whole nautical chain is indispensable to achieve the ambition of the Port of Rotterdam, to become World Leader in the area of sustainability, efficiency and safety. 
The red line in this is the integration of information and a more central planning of vessel traffic.

profile_positions.description: Based in the regional operational head office in Rotterdam, within Maersk Liner Operations Centre (LOC) heading up the Cargo Port Range Coordinators and IMO specialists situated at the different NEU terminal locations, through assistant Managers. The teams focus is on enabling cost efficient and smooth cargo operations for customers cargo to and from vessels calls, both mainliner and feeder vessles carrying Maersk Line and dealing with operational claims originating at the terminals. Responsible for understanding and solving local (authority, dangerous goods and custom) challenges which would lead to inefficient cargo operations and potential no loading. All done with the customer in mind while maximizing cost recovery and keeping safety as a priority. Being the escalation point when it comes down to regularity, authority, customm, dangerous goods, local operations, damage and incident handling through the region. Support in larger vessel and/or port incidents and act as Maersk touch point towards relevant authorities.
